article_title: CNN's Daniel Burke survived a GetReligion interview, but will his 'Friendly Atheists' story endure our critique? — GetReligion
article_text:
That there title is what is known as clickbait.

I know you people: You fancy a nice train wreck. You crave a good, no-holds-barred professional wrestling match. You love GetReligion the most when we're whacking some incompetent "journalist" (hey, how do you like those scare quotes, media person!?) over the head with a 2-by-4.

Sadly, today I come to praise CNN Religion Editor Daniel Burke, not to bury him.

And I knew you wouldn't dare click if I said something vanilla like "CNN produces a really nice piece of religion journalism." (Yawn.)

Come to think of it, Burke didn't really write about religion, did he? If you read my 5Q+1 interview with him the other day, you know that he produced a 10,000-plus-word opus on atheists:

That there title is what is known as clickbait.

I know you people: You fancy a nice train wreck. You crave a good, 
no-holds-barred professional wrestling match. You love GetReligion the most 
when we're whacking some incompetent "journalist" (hey, how do you
 like those scare quotes, media person!?) over the head with a 2-by-4.

Sadly, today I come to praise CNN Religion Editor Daniel Burke, not to bury 
him. 

And I knew you wouldn't dare click if I said something vanilla like "CNN 
produces a really nice piece of religion journalism." (Yawn.)

Come to think of it, Burke didn't really write about religion, did he? If 
you read my 5Q+1 interview with him the other day, you know that he 
produced a 10,000-plus-word opus on atheists.

Hmmmm, "Religion editor can't find religion to write about." Maybe that's
 my angle.

I kid. I kid.

article_summary:
Sadly, today I come to praise CNN Religion Editor Daniel Burke, not to bury him.
Come to think of it, Burke didn't really write about religion, did he?
And I knew you wouldn't dare click if I said something vanilla like "CNN produces a really nice piece of religion journalism."
If you read my 5Q+1 interview with him the other day, you know that he produced a 10,000-plus-word opus on atheists:
You love GetReligion the most when we're whacking some incompetent "journalist" (hey, how do you like those scare quotes, media person!?)
